name: Pop Music Songs of 1977 Quiz | 1970s Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Chicago-based female vocal group had a number one single in the U.S. with their disco song "Best of My Love"?
questions.explanation:
The Emotions.

	The Emotions were formed in Chicago and originally consisted of the Hutchinson sisters: Jeanette, Sheila and Wanda. Their upbeat song "Best of My Love" soared to the top of the U.S. Billboard singles charts in the summer of 1977. The song was co-written by Maurice White and Al McKay of Earth, Wind & Fire fame.Some of the lyrics to this song read: "Whoa, whoa, you've got the best of my love / Whoa, whoa you've got the best of my love.." The Emotions and Earth, Wind & Fire would later combine to make a hit called "Boogie Wonderland." Rose Royce ("Car Wash") hailed from Los Angeles. The Spinners, an all-male vocal group, were formed in Detroit.

questions.text: The group Eagles reached the number one spot in the U.S. pop charts with their hit "Hotel California." Please complete this line from the song's opening verse: "On a ________________ , cool wind in my hair / Warm smell of colitas, rising up through the air..."
questions.explanation:
dark desert  highway.

	"On a dark desert highway, cool wind in my hair..." With these lyrics, a classic rock song begins. Don Felder, Glenn Frey and Don Henley of Eagles composed "Hotel California", a tune which supposedly explores the dark side of night life in the Los Angeles area. "Hotel California" topped the U.S. singles charts in May 1977 and became one of the most requested songs in pop music history.

questions.text: Which star from the hit TV series "Starsky & Hutch" recorded a top ten U.S. single called "Don't Give Up On Us"?
questions.explanation:
David Soul.

	"Starsky & Hutch" was a popular television series in the USA (and elsewhere)  from 1975 to 1979. It starred David Soul and Paul Michael Glaser as California police officers. Soul was able to utilize his good looks and soft singing voice to forge a singing career. "Don't Give Up On Us" reached the number one spot in both the U.S. and the U.K. in January 1977. Soul sings, "Don't give up on us, I know / We can still come through..." Stephen Bishop had a 1977 hit song with "On and On"; Shaun Cassidy had success with ""Da Doo Ron Ron."

questions.text: Which cocktail does American singer Jimmy Buffett pay homage to in a 1977 top ten song?
questions.explanation:
Margarita.

	Jimmy Buffett achieved success in 1977 with his song "Margaritaville." The song pays homage to a relaxed lifestyle, fueled by a passion for margarita, his favorite "adult beverage." A classic margarita cocktail is made of tequila, triple sec, and lime juice, with an added touch of salt. In the song's lyrics, Buffett says that he is "wasting away in Margaritaville / searching for my lost shaker of salt..." This tune was released in January 1977 and reached the number eight position in the U.S. Billboard singles chart.

questions.text: Stevie Wonder reached the number one spot in the U.S. singles charts with "Sir Duke." Which one of these jazz legends is *not* mentioned in the song's lyrics?
questions.explanation:
Benny Goodman.

	The song "Sir Duke" comes from Stevie Wonder's popular 1976 album "Songs in the Key of Life." In this song, Wonder pays tribute to several great jazz musicians, including "Basie, Miller, Satchmo / And the king of all, Sir Duke / And with a voice like Ella's ringing out / There's no way the band can lose..." However, Wonder does not mention jazz great Benny Goodman in the lyrics. "Sir Duke" reached the top spot in the U.S. singles charts in May 1977 and remained there for three weeks.

questions.text: Please complete this opening line from Foreigner's 1977 top ten single "Cold As Ice": "You're as cold as ice / You're willing to __________ our love..."
questions.explanation:
sacrifice.

	Lou Gramm belts out, "You're as cold as ice / You're willing to sacrifice our love..." to open Foreigner's hit song "Cold as Ice". This tune, released in July 1977, climbed to the number six spot on the U.S. Billboard charts. Foreigner's lineup consisted of Gramm, Mick Jones, Ian McDonald, Dennis Elliott, Al Greenwood, and Ed Gagliardi. Foreigner also had a 1977 hit with the song "Feels Like the First Time."

questions.text: In January 1977, British singer Leo Sayer had a number one U.S. hit with a song entitled "You Make Me Feel Like ____________ ".
questions.explanation:
dancing.

	"You Make Me Feel Like Dancing" was released in 1976, and it became a number one hit in the U.S. singles charts in January 1977. Leo Sayer, born in Shoreham-by-Sea, England, won a Grammy Award for this song. Some of the song's lyrics are, "You make me feel like dancing / I'm gonna dance the night away..." Sayer also reached the top of the 1977 U.S. charts with his recording of "When I Need You".

questions.text: In 1977, pop idol Andy Gibb recorded a number one hit in the U.S. containing the following lyrics: "Darling mine / I would wait forever for those lips of wine / This love will shine, girl..." What is the name of this popular song?
questions.correct: I Just Want to Be Your Everything
questions.explanation:
I Just Want to Be Your Everything.

	The Australian-raised singer Andy Gibb enjoyed a tremendous amount of success in 1977 with his hit single "I Just Want to Be Your Everything." This song topped the U.S. singles charts in August 1977. "Run to Me" (1972), "Night Fever" (1978) and "Stayin' Alive" (1978) were hit singles for Andy Gibbs' brothers, the famous Bee Gees.

questions.text: In 1977, sisters Ann and Nancy Wilson achieved success with their single "Barracuda" -- what is the name of the band which recorded this top twenty song?
questions.explanation:
Heart.

	Ann Wilson, Nancy Wilson, Roger Fisher, and Michael DeRosier were among several musicians who formed the rock band Heart. In 1977, Heart recorded the hard rock song "Barracuda", and the tune eventually reached the number 11 position on the U.S. Billboard charts. "Barracuda" has remained a staple for classic rock stations since then. The group Kansas had a hit with "Carry On My Wayward Son"; Heatwave sang "Boogie Nights"; and Brick hit the charts with "Dazz."

questions.text: Which "Southern fried" rock band from South Carolina had a top twenty U.S. single in 1977 with its tune "Heard It in a Love Song"?
questions.explanation:
The Marshall Tucker Band.

	The Marshall Tucker Band, led by guitarist Toy Caldwell, was formed in Spartanburg, South Carolina. The "Tucker Boys" were well-known for their hard-rocking concerts and improvisational style. "Heard It in a Love Song" was the band's one foray into the U.S. top 40 singles scene; the song reached number 14 on the U.S. Billboard charts in March 1977. Some of the lyrics read: "Heard it in a love song, heard it in a love song / Can't be wrong..." The Allman Brothers Band and the Atlanta Rhythm Section are associated with Georgia, and Lynyrd Skynyrd hails from Florida.
